0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• premedicate with Lugol's solution (Strong Iodine Solution USP) 10 drops ORALLY three times daily starting at least 24 hours before administration of iodinated albumin I-125; continue 1 to 2 weeks after procedure
  • Blood volume estimation; Diagnosis: 0.185 to 1.85 megabecquerels (5 to 50 microcuries) IV; MAX 7.4 megabecquerels (200 microcuries) weekly for repeated dosing; premedicate with Lugol's solution 10 drops ORALLY three times daily starting at least 24 hours before administration, continue 1 to 2 weeks after procedure
  • Plasma volume measurement; Diagnosis: 0.185 to 1.85 megabecquerels (5 to 50 microcuries) IV; MAX 7.4 megabecquerels (200 microcuries) weekly for repeated dosing; premedicate with Lugol's solution 10 drops ORALLY three times daily starting at least 24 hours before administration, continue 1 to 2 weeks after procedure

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Blood volume estimation; Diagnosis
  • Plasma volume measurement; Diagnosis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• cisternography use; reported cases of hyperpyrexia and aseptic chemical meningeal irritation
  • standard radioactivity precautions
  • women of childbearing capability

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• AAP: Radioactive compounds that require temporary cessation of breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Iodinated I-125 albumin is a diagnostic radiopharmaceutical that acts by uniformly distributing into the intra- and extravascular spaces, thereby allowing for use in determination of total blood and plasma volumes.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    use proper procedures for handling and disposal of radiopharmaceuticals
  • Intravenous
    • remove an aliquot from vial identical in volume to dose to be administered to patient
    • prepare reference solution using normal saline as a diluent; recommended dilution 1:4000
    • determine radioactivity of reference solution
    • inject dose into large vein in arm, measure residual radioactivity in both syringe and needle
    • withdraw blood sample at 5 and 15 minutes from other arm after injecting dose; use sterile heparinized syringe
    • take a known aliquot from each blood sample and determine radioconcentration; for plasma volume concentration, blood is centrifuged and red blood cells are removed
    • determine background blood radioconcentration if repeated blood volume or blood plasma measurements are necessary

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: no specific monitoring has been determined

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug is excreted in breast milk. Use formula-feedings in place of breastfeedings.
  • Advise women of childbearing potential that examinations, especially those elective in nature, are ideally performed during the first few days (approximately 10 days) following onset of menses.
